abstract: The researchers are considered a key to the company’s future. But they have had a hard time shaking infighting and controversy over a variety of issues.
lead_paragraph: Less than two years after Google dismissed two researchers who criticized the biases built into artificial intelligence systems, the company has fired a researcher who questioned a paper it published on the abilities of a specialized type of artificial intelligence used in making computer chips.
snippet: The researchers are considered a key to the company’s future. But they have had a hard time shaking infighting and controversy over a variety of issues.
headline.main: Another Firing Among Google’s A.I. Brain Trust, and More Discord

The researchers are considered a key to the company’s future. But they have had a hard time shaking infighting and controversy over a variety of issues. Another Firing Among Google’s A.I. Brain Trust, and More Discord

abstract: They moved from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus and other countries for jobs in the technology industry. Now they are joined by friends fleeing war and repression.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Over the past five years, Andrey Doronichev has shared his four-story townhouse with nearly 100 entrepreneurs, investors and other aspiring technologists from countries that were once part of the Soviet Union.
snippet: They moved from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus and other countries for jobs in the technology industry. Now they are joined by friends fleeing war and repression.
headline.main: Russian-Speaking Technologists Rebuild Their Lives in a San Francisco Home

They moved from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus and other countries for jobs in the technology industry. Now they are joined by friends fleeing war and repression. Russian-Speaking Technologists Rebuild Their Lives in a San Francisco Home

abstract: The addition of one of the most widely spoken Indigenous languages in the Americas could help public servants and health workers connect with their communities. (And by the way, “allinllachu” means hello.)
lead_paragraph: LIMA — When Irma Alvarez Ccoscco heard that the language she has spoken her entire life, Quechua, had been added to Google Translate, she hurried to her computer to try it out.
snippet: The addition of one of the most widely spoken Indigenous languages in the Americas could help public servants and health workers connect with their communities. (And by the way, “allinllachu” means hello.)
headline.main: ‘Allinllachu.’ Google Translate Adds Quechua to Its Platform.
text: The addition of one of the most widely spoken Indigenous languages in the Americas could help public servants and health workers connect with their communities. (And by the way, “allinllachu” means hello.) LIMA — When Irma Alvarez Ccoscco heard that the language she has spoken her entire life, Quechua, had been added to Google Translate, she hurried to her computer to try it out. The addition of one of the most widely spoken Indigenous languages in the Americas could help public servants and health workers connect with their communities. (And by the way, “allinllachu” means hello.) ‘Allinllachu.’ Google Translate Adds Quechua to Its Platform.

abstract: The crypto exchange’s collapse is stoking fears of contagion across the industry. Meanwhile, FTX’s founder, Sam Bankman-Fried, is still speaking out.
lead_paragraph: The breadth of the global fallout from FTX’s collapse has continued to emerge. Temasek, Singapore’s state-backed fund, said on Thursday that it had fully written down its $275 million investment in the crypto exchange, joining the Silicon Valley firm Sequoia Capital and SoftBank, the Japanese tech conglomerate, in declaring their stakes worthless.
snippet: The crypto exchange’s collapse is stoking fears of contagion across the industry. Meanwhile, FTX’s founder, Sam Bankman-Fried, is still speaking out.
headline.main: Investor Losses From FTX’s Implosion Are Growing

The crypto exchange’s collapse is stoking fears of contagion across the industry. Meanwhile, FTX’s founder, Sam Bankman-Fried, is still speaking out. Investor Losses From FTX’s Implosion Are Growing

abstract: From more photo-based results to neighborhood “vibe” checks, the company announced updates meant to keep two of its most popular products on trend.
lead_paragraph: Google’s search engine looks a little different these days. Results pages are now often filled with shopping items, maps, news articles, information bulletins and ads before people can scroll to lists of results — the blue links that became synonymous with the service.
snippet: From more photo-based results to neighborhood “vibe” checks, the company announced updates meant to keep two of its most popular products on trend.
headline.main: Google to Make Search and Maps More ‘Immersive’

From more photo-based results to neighborhood “vibe” checks, the company announced updates meant to keep two of its most popular products on trend. Google to Make Search and Maps More ‘Immersive’

abstract: Google’s parent company reported earnings that were below analysts’ expectations, bringing in $13.9 billion in profit on $69.1 billion in sales.
lead_paragraph: Even Alphabet, the parent company of Google and one of the internet’s most entrenched businesses, was not immune to the punishing blows of the global economy and a sharp slowdown in the online advertising that is essential to the company’s profits.
snippet: Google’s parent company reported earnings that were below analysts’ expectations, bringing in $13.9 billion in profit on $69.1 billion in sales.
headline.main: Alphabet’s Profit Drops 27 Percent From a Year Earlier

Google’s parent company reported earnings that were below analysts’ expectations, bringing in $13.9 billion in profit on $69.1 billion in sales. Alphabet’s Profit Drops 27 Percent From a Year Earlier

abstract: Already suspended under the platform’s Covid-19 misinformation rules, he continued to post videos daring YouTube to ban him.
lead_paragraph: YouTube said on Wednesday that it had terminated accounts associated with Dan Bongino, a popular right-wing radio and Fox News host, nearly two weeks after it first suspended his channel for violating its Covid-19 misinformation policy.
snippet: Already suspended under the platform’s Covid-19 misinformation rules, he continued to post videos daring YouTube to ban him.
headline.main: YouTube Bars Right-Wing Media Personality Dan Bongino

Already suspended under the platform’s Covid-19 misinformation rules, he continued to post videos daring YouTube to ban him. YouTube Bars Right-Wing Media Personality Dan Bongino

abstract: The earnings by Google’s parent company were below analysts’ expectations of $17.5 billion in net profit on $69.9 billion in revenue.
lead_paragraph: Google’s search engine business is demonstrating resilience in the face of a slowing economy and rising inflation, but its other businesses have not been able to escape a downturn in online advertising.
snippet: The earnings by Google’s parent company were below analysts’ expectations of $17.5 billion in net profit on $69.9 billion in revenue.
headline.main: Alphabet’s profit dropped 14 percent in the second quarter.
text: The earnings by Google’s parent company were below analysts’ expectations of $17.5 billion in net profit on $69.9 billion in revenue. Google’s search engine business is demonstrating resilience in the face of a slowing economy and rising inflation, but its other businesses have not been able to escape a downturn in online advertising. The earnings by Google’s parent company were below analysts’ expectations of $17.5 billion in net profit on $69.9 billion in revenue. Alphabet’s profit dropped 14 percent in the second quarter.

abstract: The deal is intended to help Google differentiate its cloud business from that of its rivals Amazon and Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Google announced one of its largest acquisitions on Tuesday, paying roughly $5.4 billion for the cybersecurity company Mandiant, a provider of services that help businesses prepare for and respond to cyberattacks.
snippet: The deal is intended to help Google differentiate its cloud business from that of its rivals Amazon and Microsoft.
headline.main: Google is buying Mandiant, a cybersecurity firm, for $5.4 billion.
text: The deal is intended to help Google differentiate its cloud business from that of its rivals Amazon and Microsoft. Google announced one of its largest acquisitions on Tuesday, paying roughly $5.4 billion for the cybersecurity company Mandiant, a provider of services that help businesses prepare for and respond to cyberattacks. The deal is intended to help Google differentiate its cloud business from that of its rivals Amazon and Microsoft. Google is buying Mandiant, a cybersecurity firm, for $5.4 billion.

abstract: The company will not be allowed to import products that infringe on Sonos patents, including smart speakers, video streaming devices, and some computers and phones.
lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Google infringed on five audio technology patents held by the speaker manufacturer Sonos and is not allowed to import products that violate Sonos’s intellectual property into the United States, a trade court ruled on Thursday.
snippet: The company will not be allowed to import products that infringe on Sonos patents, including smart speakers, video streaming devices, and some computers and phones.
headline.main: Google Infringed on Sonos Speaker Technology, Trade Court Rules
text: The company will not be allowed to import products that infringe on Sonos patents, including smart speakers, video streaming devices, and some computers and phones. OAKLAND, Calif. — Google infringed on five audio technology patents held by the speaker manufacturer Sonos and is not allowed to import products that violate Sonos’s intellectual property into the United States, a trade court ruled on Thursday. The company will not be allowed to import products that infringe on Sonos patents, including smart speakers, video streaming devices, and some computers and phones. Google Infringed on Sonos Speaker Technology, Trade Court Rules

abstract: Worried about geopolitical tensions and stung by pandemic shutdowns, Google, Apple and others are moving some work to nearby countries.
lead_paragraph: In the coming weeks, Apple and Google will unveil their latest generation of smartphones, jockeying to distinguish the new devices from previous models. But one of the most significant changes will go largely unnoticed by consumers: Some of these phones will not be made in China.
snippet: Worried about geopolitical tensions and stung by pandemic shutdowns, Google, Apple and others are moving some work to nearby countries.
headline.main: Tech Companies Slowly Shift Production Away From China

In the coming weeks, Apple and Google will unveil their latest generation of smartphones, jockeying to distinguish the new devices from previous models. But one of the most significant changes will go largely unnoticed by consumers: Some of these phones will not be made in China. Worried about geopolitical tensions and stung by pandemic shutdowns, Google, Apple and others are moving some work to nearby countries. Tech Companies Slowly Shift Production Away From China

abstract: The Federal Reserve has more jumbo-size interest rises planned, stoking fears of downturns in the housing, labor and stock markets.
lead_paragraph: For a third straight meeting, the Fed raised its benchmark interest rate by 75 basis points — and it’s hardly done. Count on an additional 1.25 percentage points’ worth of increases this year, the Fed chair Jay Powell said yesterday, which would bring the Fed funds rate to 4.4 percent by the end of 2022, and 4.6 percent next year.
snippet: The Federal Reserve has more jumbo-size interest rises planned, stoking fears of downturns in the housing, labor and stock markets.
headline.main: After a Big Rate Increase, Markets Fear a Recession

abstract: Siri, Google Search, online marketing and your child’s homework will never be the same. Then there’s the misinformation problem.
lead_paragraph: This month, Jeremy Howard, an artificial intelligence researcher, introduced an online chatbot called ChatGPT to his 7-year-old daughter. It had been released a few days earlier by OpenAI, one of the world’s most ambitious A.I. labs.
snippet: Siri, Google Search, online marketing and your child’s homework will never be the same. Then there’s the misinformation problem.
headline.main: The New Chatbots Could Change the World. Can You Trust Them?

abstract: The internet giant, planning on employees returning to the office for a few days a week, is building another $1 billion office less than two miles away.
lead_paragraph: Google said Friday that it would spend $1 billion to purchase a London office building, making it the owner of another high-priced piece of real estate as the internet giant bets on an eventual return to office for its employees around the world.
snippet: The internet giant, planning on employees returning to the office for a few days a week, is building another $1 billion office less than two miles away.
headline.main: Google pays $1 billion for a London office building.

abstract: Disappointing earnings from Microsoft, Alphabet and Texas Instruments reveal the big challenges facing technology giants.
lead_paragraph: The recent rally in technology stocks could come to a screeching halt at the opening bell on Wednesday. Overnight, investors dumped portions of their tech portfolios after disappointing results from Alphabet, Microsoft and Texas Instruments, with the trio reporting that a slowing global economy continues to batter demand for digital advertising, cloud computing and chips.
snippet: Disappointing earnings from Microsoft, Alphabet and Texas Instruments reveal the big challenges facing technology giants.
headline.main: Tech Stocks Tumble as Growth Falters

Disappointing earnings from Microsoft, Alphabet and Texas Instruments reveal the big challenges facing technology giants. Tech Stocks Tumble as Growth Falters

abstract: Contracts that could total $9 billion were awarded to Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle. An earlier effort, won by Microsoft, was scrapped after rivals objected.
lead_paragraph: The Defense Department said Wednesday that it had awarded lucrative cloud-computing contracts to four companies: Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle. The contracts run through 2028 and could be valued as high as $9 billion, the Pentagon said in a news release.
snippet: Contracts that could total $9 billion were awarded to Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle. An earlier effort, won by Microsoft, was scrapped after rivals objected.
headline.main: Pentagon Divides Big Cloud-Computing Deal Among 4 Firms

abstract: Artificial intelligence is being woven into an array of the company’s products. But the change — for now — is subtle.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — There was a time when Google offered a wondrous vision of the future, with driverless cars, augmented-reality eyewear, unlimited storage of emails and photos, and predictive texts to complete sentences in progress.
snippet: Artificial intelligence is being woven into an array of the company’s products. But the change — for now — is subtle.
headline.main: Google Offers a More Modest Vision of the Future

abstract: The tech giant admitted no wrongdoing as it resolved four women’s claims of widespread pay biases. The company will also allow an outside monitor to review its practices.
lead_paragraph: Google has settled a class-action lawsuit that accused it of systematically underpaying women, promising to provide $118 million in monetary relief and invite outsiders to review its pay practices.
snippet: The tech giant admitted no wrongdoing as it resolved four women’s claims of widespread pay biases. The company will also allow an outside monitor to review its practices.
headline.main: Google Agrees to Pay $118 Million to Settle Pay Discrimination Case

The tech giant admitted no wrongdoing as it resolved four women’s claims of widespread pay biases. The company will also allow an outside monitor to review its practices. abstract: Google says its goals for carbon-free power are impeded by state-regulated utilities, particularly in the Southeast, that lack a competitive market.

abstract: A video producer claims he was fired after he complained that an obscure group based in the Sierra foothills dominated a business unit at Google.
lead_paragraph: OREGON HOUSE, Calif. — In a tiny town in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada, a religious organization called the Fellowship of Friends has established an elaborate, 1,200-acre compound full of art and ornate architecture.

abstract: Under pressure from employees and supporters of reproductive rights, the company announced privacy changes for the post-Roe era.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Google said on Friday that it would delete abortion clinic visits from the location history of its users, in the company’s first effort to address how it will handle sensitive data in the wake of the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade.
snippet: Under pressure from employees and supporters of reproductive rights, the company announced privacy changes for the post-Roe era.
headline.main: Google Says It Will Delete Location Data When Users Visit Abortion Clinics

abstract: After nearly three years, Google has decided to winnow its video game ambitions because Stadia was less popular than it had anticipated.
lead_paragraph: Google said it would shutter the video game streaming service Stadia, its answer to Microsoft’s Xbox and Sony’s PlayStation video game consoles, in another sign of Google’s drive to be leaner amid fears of an economic slowdown.
snippet: After nearly three years, Google has decided to winnow its video game ambitions because Stadia was less popular than it had anticipated.

After nearly three years, Google has decided to winnow its video game ambitions because Stadia was less popular than it had anticipated. Google to Shut Down Stadia Video Game Streaming Service

abstract: The lawsuit echoes many of the complaints Black employees have expressed over the years about working at the company.
lead_paragraph: A former employee at Google sued the company on Friday, claiming it systematically discriminated against Black workers by placing them in lower-level jobs, underpaying them and denying them opportunities to advance.
snippet: The lawsuit echoes many of the complaints Black employees have expressed over the years about working at the company.

abstract: Leaving room for disagreement is gracious, not timid.
lead_paragraph: I want to take up a language peeve I hear a lot about: The uptick in (often younger) people prefacing their opinions with “I feel like”: “I feel like it’s a matter of duty,” “I feel like people are ignoring the consequences” and so on.
snippet: Leaving room for disagreement is gracious, not timid.
headline.main: I Think It’s Fine to Say ‘I Feel Like.’ I Reckon Others Do, Too.

Leaving room for disagreement is gracious, not timid. I Think It’s Fine to Say ‘I Feel Like.’ I Reckon Others Do, Too.

abstract: People who upload images of children that Google flags as potentially illegal will be able to provide more context to appeal bans.
lead_paragraph: When Google informed a mother in Colorado that her account had been disabled, it felt as if her house had burned down, she said. In an instant, she lost access to her wedding photos, videos of her son growing up, her emails going back a decade, her tax documents and everything else she had kept in what she thought would be the safest place. She had no idea why.
snippet: People who upload images of children that Google flags as potentially illegal will be able to provide more context to appeal bans.
headline.main: Her Child’s Naked Dance Killed Her Google Account. New Appeals Path Restored It.

She had no idea why. People who upload images of children that Google flags as potentially illegal will be able to provide more context to appeal bans. Her Child’s Naked Dance Killed Her Google Account. New Appeals Path Restored It.

abstract: Developed with Fitbit, Google’s first smart watch takes a page from Apple’s playbook by requiring loyalty to its brand.
lead_paragraph: It’s 2022, and Google finally has a response to the Apple Watch. It’s the Pixel Watch, which is essentially a Fitbit designed to work only with Android phones and seemingly a direct counterattack to Apple’s wearable that works only with iPhones.
snippet: Developed with Fitbit, Google’s first smart watch takes a page from Apple’s playbook by requiring loyalty to its brand.
headline.main: The Google Watch Is Here. But You’d Better Love Android.

Developed with Fitbit, Google’s first smart watch takes a page from Apple’s playbook by requiring loyalty to its brand. The Google Watch Is Here. But You’d Better Love Android.

abstract: The social network’s new owner has just a few days to determine whether to pay millions to employees, or get rid of them.

abstract: It’s not about elaborate preparation.
lead_paragraph: As part of The Times’s 31 Days of Holiday Treasures, a digital advent calendar of delight, my colleague Susan Shain talks to moms who are ditching the pressure to make “holiday magic.” The term is everywhere these days — Spotify has a Holiday Magic playlist, the arts and crafts chain Michaels has a Holiday Magic online landing page — but for those looking for a definition, “holiday magic” is sort of a cottage industry of crafting, baking, decorating and event-planning starting around Thanksgiving that mostly (but not exclusively) moms undertake.
snippet: It’s not about elaborate preparation.
headline.main: True ‘Holiday Magic’ Can’t Be Manufactured
text: It’s not about elaborate preparation. As part of The Times’s 31 Days of Holiday Treasures, a digital advent calendar of delight, my colleague Susan Shain talks to moms who are ditching the pressure to make “holiday magic.” The term is everywhere these days — Spotify has a Holiday Magic playlist, the arts and crafts chain Michaels has a Holiday Magic online landing page — but for those looking for a definition, “holiday magic” is sort of a cottage industry of crafting, baking, decorating and event-planning starting around Thanksgiving that mostly (but not exclusively) moms undertake. It’s not about elaborate preparation. True ‘Holiday Magic’ Can’t Be Manufactured

abstract: Possible U.F.O. sightings, A.I. breakthroughs and the Jan. 6 hearings all help us understand how hard it to grasp what is happening right in front of us.
lead_paragraph: In a recent essay called “How to Future,” Kevin Kelly, one of the founding editors of Wired, writes that “most futurists are really predicting the present. It turns out that the present is very hard to see.” What will upend tomorrow often looks like an aberration, niche, triviality or impossibility today. He goes on to offer advice I’ve been mulling: “I sometimes think of ‘seeing the present’ as trying on alien eyes: looking at the world as if I were an alien from another planet.”
snippet: Possible U.F.O. sightings, A.I. breakthroughs and the Jan. 6 hearings all help us understand how hard it to grasp what is happening right in front of us.
headline.main: This Is a Weirder Moment Than You Think
text: Possible U.F.O. sightings, A.I. breakthroughs and the Jan. 6 hearings all help us understand how hard it to grasp what is happening right in front of us.  In a recent essay called “How to Future,” Kevin Kelly, one of the founding editors of Wired, writes that “most futurists are really predicting the present. It turns out that the present is very hard to see.” What will upend tomorrow often looks like an aberration, niche, triviality or impossibility today. He goes on to offer advice I’ve been mulling: “I sometimes think of ‘seeing the present’ as trying on alien eyes: looking at the world as if I were an alien from another planet.” Possible U.F.O. sightings, A.I. breakthroughs and the Jan. 6 hearings all help us understand how hard it to grasp what is happening right in front of us.  This Is a Weirder Moment Than You Think

abstract: The move came after a Russian regulator demanded that the company stop showing ads with what the regulator claimed was false information about the invasion of Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: Google said on Thursday night that it had suspended all advertising in Russia after the country’s internet regulator demanded that the company stop showing what it considered ads displaying false information about Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

abstract: Tech companies are slowing their frenetic hiring, but a combination of dominance and diversity is turning out to be — yet again — an overwhelming asset.
lead_paragraph: No boom can last forever, even for the technology industry’s most affluent companies. Investors punished the biggest tech companies earlier this year, erasing $2 trillion in market value over fears the industry would falter in the face of rising inflation and a slowing economy.
snippet: Tech companies are slowing their frenetic hiring, but a combination of dominance and diversity is turning out to be — yet again — an overwhelming asset.
headline.main: Big Tech Is Proving Resilient as the Economy Cools

Tech companies are slowing their frenetic hiring, but a combination of dominance and diversity is turning out to be — yet again — an overwhelming asset. abstract: The company also said it would restore many of its famed office perks.
lead_paragraph: As Google prepares to bring workers back to its offices, the company is relaxing some of its Covid-19 workplace policies, including a rule requiring U.S. employees to be vaccinated. But workers will still have to be vaccinated if they plan to use the company’s offices.
snippet: The company also said it would restore many of its famed office perks.

Google eases pandemic rules for employees in the U.S.

abstract: Four were dismissed, and two were disciplined. Google has said its actions had nothing to do with trying to combat unionization efforts.

abstract: Investors sent the electric vehicle maker’s shares down sharply in after-hours trading after the company warned about uncertain customer demand.
lead_paragraph: Investors punished Tesla for cutting its growth forecast on Wednesday, sending shares tumbling nearly 6 percent lower in premarket trading, despite Elon Musk’s efforts to play down worries about slowing demand amid broader worries about the economy and growing competition.

abstract: It says it will give other companies plenty of time to adapt to changes to its Android software. Similar changes made by Apple affected big internet companies.

abstract: The earnings by the parent company of Google were above analysts’ estimates.
lead_paragraph: These days, there is so much uncertainty surrounding Google’s parent company, Alphabet: a global pandemic, fears of inflation gripping the U.S. economy, restive employees challenging management, and regulators and politicians seemingly bent on taking their pound of flesh.
snippet: The earnings by the parent company of Google were above analysts’ estimates.
headline.main: Alphabet’s profit increased 36 percent, to $20.64 billion, in the fourth quarter.

The earnings by the parent company of Google were above analysts’ estimates. Alphabet’s profit increased 36 percent, to $20.64 billion, in the fourth quarter.

abstract: The engineer, Blake Lemoine, contends that the company’s language model has a soul. The company denies that and says he violated its security policies.

abstract: In the absence of federal privacy legislation, the state’s law is considered among the nation’s strongest.
lead_paragraph: The facial recognition company Clearview AI agreed in a settlement this month to stop selling its massive database of photographs culled from the internet to private firms across the United States. That decision is a direct result of a lawsuit in Illinois, a demonstration that strong privacy laws in a single state can have nationwide ramifications.
snippet: In the absence of federal privacy legislation, the state’s law is considered among the nation’s strongest.

abstract: Alphabet, Exxon Mobil, UPS and others gave shareholders reasons to stay optimistic.
lead_paragraph: We are almost at the halfway point for earnings season, and jittery investors are looking to corporate financial reports for direction after inflation, geopolitics and other worries dragged down markets last month. It’s been a different story in the past few days, though, as robust earnings reports steadied nerves.

abstract: The states argue that Google reached a deal with Facebook to have the social network join its effort in an effort to “kill” a competing ad network.

abstract: The project is a big bet on scaling up programs that have proved effective in lifting low-income workers into middle-class jobs and careers.

abstract: The effort is the first time the tech giant has tried to get a government case against it tossed out.

abstract: Google is charging some small businesses for email and other apps after more than a decade of free use. Business owners say Google is being callous.

Dalton Jr., a longtime user who operates a scholastic test-prep company in Vancouver, British Columbia.

abstract: Markets expect another big interest rate increase on Wednesday. But investors are also anxious about the central bank’s coming moves.

abstract: British researchers and a team from Google found that teaching people how to spot misinformation made people more skeptical of it.
lead_paragraph: In the fight against online misinformation, falsehoods have key advantages: They crop up fast and spread at the speed of electrons, and there is a lag period before fact checkers can debunk them.
snippet: British researchers and a team from Google found that teaching people how to spot misinformation made people more skeptical of it.

abstract: A new wave of chat bots like ChatGPT use artificial intelligence that could reinvent or even replace the traditional internet search engine.
lead_paragraph: Over the past three decades, a handful of products like Netscape’s web browser, Google’s search engine and Apple’s iPhone have truly upended the tech industry and made what came before them look like lumbering dinosaurs.
snippet: A new wave of chat bots like ChatGPT use artificial intelligence that could reinvent or even replace the traditional internet search engine.
headline.main: A New Chat Bot Is a ‘Code Red’ for Google’s Search Business
text: A new wave of chat bots like ChatGPT use artificial intelligence that could reinvent or even replace the traditional internet search engine. abstract: The suit claimed that the Fellowship of Friends, an obscure group based in the Sierra Nevada foothills, gained influence inside Google.
lead_paragraph: A former video producer for Google has settled a lawsuit that claimed he was fired after he complained that a religious sect had gained a foothold inside a business unit of the company.
snippet: The suit claimed that the Fellowship of Friends, an obscure group based in the Sierra Nevada foothills, gained influence inside Google.
headline.main: Ex-Google Contractor Settles Lawsuit Over Religious Sect
text: The suit claimed that the Fellowship of Friends, an obscure group based in the Sierra Nevada foothills, gained influence inside Google. A former video producer for Google has settled a lawsuit that claimed he was fired after he complained that a religious sect had gained a foothold inside a business unit of the company. The suit claimed that the Fellowship of Friends, an obscure group based in the Sierra Nevada foothills, gained influence inside Google. Ex-Google Contractor Settles Lawsuit Over Religious Sect
